intro: Ficinia cedarbergensis, commonly known as the Cedarberg sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its slender, grass-like stems are often clustered, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in early spring. Ficinia cedarbergensis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
